title: Stories of the Border Marches
author: Lang, John
snippet: Accompanied by two Jardines anda Johnston--good Border names--and by some other men, Meldrum seizedLord Durie and a friend near St. Andrews, robbed them of their purses,then carried the judge across the Firth of Forth to the house of oneWilliam Kay in Leith, thence past Holyrood, and, by way doubtless ofSoutra Hill, to Melrose, from which town he was hurried over the Borderto Harbottle, and there held prisoner.
